Uses of Interface
fr.upmc.components.interfaces.OfferedI

  • Packages that use OfferedI 
    Package Description
    fr.upmc.components.connectors
    Hierarchy of connector objects to assemble components.
    fr.upmc.components.cvm
    Component virtual machines for both single computer and distributed deployments.
    fr.upmc.components.cvm.pre.dcc
    Dynamic remote component creation and connection for component assemblies.
    fr.upmc.components.examples.basic_cs.interfaces  
    fr.upmc.components.examples.basic_cs.ports  
    fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.filter
    Component and port for sensor simulators The package fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.filter provides a filtering component that behaves as a sensor so that sensor clients need not know whether they are connected to sensors or filters.
    fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.gauge
    Component and port for gauges The package fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.gauge provides a gauge component used to display value read from a sensor.
    fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.rng.interfaces
    Interfaces for random number generation services The package fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.rng.interfaces provides interfaces for random number generation components.
    fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.rng.ports
    Ports for random number generation services The package fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.rng.ports provides ports for random number generation components.
    fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.sensor
    Component and port for sensor simulators The package fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.sensor provides a sensor simulator component and its port used to offer its service.
    fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.sensor.interfaces
    Interfaces and data for sensor services The package fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.sensor.interfaces provides two interfaces for sensor services, a data offered interface SensorDataOfferedI for the sensor service providers and SensorDataRequiredI for the sensor service clients.

    • Uses of OfferedI in fr.upmc.components.connectors

      Subinterfaces of OfferedI in fr.upmc.components.connectors 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  DataTwoWayConnectorI
      The interface DataTwoWayConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between requiring and offering components that exchange data rather than calling services from each others, but using the same interface on both sides and act as peers in the exchange.
      interface  TwoWayConnectorI
      The interface TwoWayConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between components exposing two-way interfaces.
      Classes in fr.upmc.components.connectors that implement OfferedI 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractDataTwoWayConnector
      The class AbstractDataTwoWayConnector partially implements a basic data connector between components exchanging data in a peer to peer way rather than calling each others services.
      class  AbstractTwoWayConnector
      The class AbstractTwoWayConnector partially implements a basic connector between components calling each others services in a peer to peer way rather than in a client-provider relationship.
      class  DataTwoWayConnector
      The class DataTwoWayConnector implements a standard connector for components exchanging data in a peer-to-peer mode using standard data two-way interfaces.
      Fields in fr.upmc.components.connectors declared as OfferedI 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected OfferedI AbstractConnector.offering
      port of the component providing the service.

    • Uses of OfferedI in fr.upmc.components.cvm

      Methods in fr.upmc.components.cvm with parameters of type OfferedI 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void AbstractDistributedCVM.publishPort(OfferedI port)
      publish inbound ports (data inbound ports and two way ports) both locally and globally, which includes the RMI registry and the global component registry; outbound ports need not be published globally but only locally (this information is used by the connection builder to decide how the connections to that port must be done).
      static void AbstractDistributedCVM.unpublishPort(OfferedI port)
      unpublishes previously published inbound ports (data inbound ports and two way ports) both locally and globally, which includes the RMI registry and the global component registry; outbound ports need not be published globally but only locally.

    • Uses of OfferedI in fr.upmc.components.cvm.pre.dcc

      Subinterfaces of OfferedI in fr.upmc.components.cvm.pre.dcc 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  DynamicallyConnectableComponentI
      The interface DynamicallyConnectableI defines a component service to connect some of its port to another component at run-time.
      interface  DynamicComponentCreationI
      The interface DynamicComponentCreationI defines the component creation service offered and required interface.
      Classes in fr.upmc.components.cvm.pre.dcc that implement OfferedI 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DynamicallyConnectableComponentConnector
      The class DynamicallyConnectableComponentConnector connects a component requiring the dynamic component connection service from another component offering it.
      class  DynamicallyConnectableComponentInboundPort
      The class DynamicallyConnectableComponentInboundPort reifies the DynamicallyConnectableComponentI offered interface for a component and connects it to the requiring component through a DynamicallyConnectableComponentConnector connector.
      class  DynamicallyConnectableComponentOutboundPort
      The class DynamicallyConnectableComponentOutboundPort reifies the DynamicallyConnectableComponentI required interface for a component and connects it to the offering component through a DynamicallyConnectableComponentConnector connector.
      class  DynamicComponentCreationConnector
      The class DynamicComponentCreationConnector implements a connector between components requiring DynamicComponentCreationI and a component DynamicComponentCreator.
      class  DynamicComponentCreationInboundPort
      The class DynamicComponentCreationInboundPort implements the inbound port of a DynamicCOmponentCreator component.
      class  DynamicComponentCreationOutboundPort
      The class DynamicComponentCreationOutboundPort implements the outbound port of a DynamicCOmponentCreator client component.

      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  PairedGaugeI
      The component interface PairedGaugeI defines the service of getting the last displayed value of a gauge, and it is meant to be used by another gauge that is paired with the one receiveing the request.
      Classes in fr.upmc.components.examples.smoothing.gauge that implement OfferedI 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  PairedGaugeConnector
      The class PairedGaugeConnector implements a connector between paired gauges to allow them to exchange their displayed values.
      class  PairedGaugePort
      The class PairedGaugePort implements the port that is used to connect paired gauges to allow them to exchange their displayed values.

      class  RNGTriggerInboundPort
      The class RNGTriggerInboundPort implements the inbound port of a component of type RNGProducerI offering a trigger service for random number generation service in push mode, through the offered interface RNGTriggerI.

    • Uses of OfferedI in fr.upmc.components.interfaces

      Subinterfaces of OfferedI in fr.upmc.components.interfaces 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  DataOfferedI
      The interface DataOfferedI defines a basic interface for components that exchange raw data rather than calling each others services.
      static interface  DataOfferedI.PullI
      The interface DataOfferedI.PullI contains the signatures of the methods that can be called by the requiring components to get data from the offering component.
      static interface  DataRequiredI.PushI
      The interface DataRequiredI.PushI contains the signatures of the methods that are called by the offering component to send data to the requiring component.
      interface  DataTwoWayI
      The interface TwoWayDataI enables two components to exchange data in a peer-to-peer way, that is the two components implement the same interface and have both the sender and receiver roles.
      static interface  DataTwoWayI.PullI
      The interface TwoWayDataI.PullI contains the signature of the method that is called by one component to get data from the other component.
      static interface  DataTwoWayI.PushI
      The interface TwoWayDataI.PushI contains the signature of the method that is called by one component to send data to the other component.
      interface  TwoWayI
      The interface TwoWayI is meant to represent symmetric interfaces connecting two components that can play both the role of clients and server towards each others.

    • Uses of OfferedI in fr.upmc.components.patterns.dconnection

      Subinterfaces of OfferedI in fr.upmc.components.patterns.dconnection 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  DynamicConnectionRequestI
      The interface DynamicConnectionOfferedI is offered by components that propose a dynamic connection through some other dynamically connected interface.
      Classes in fr.upmc.components.patterns.dconnection that implement OfferedI 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DynamicConnectionRequestConnector
      The class DynamicConnectionConnector Description Invariant invariant true Created on : 2013-01-23
      class  DynamicConnectionRequestInboundPort
      The class DynamicConnectionInboundPort implements the server side port used to request and establish dynamic connections among components.
      class  DynamicConnectionRequestOutboundPort
      The class DynamicConnectionOutboundPort implements the client side port used to request and establish dynamic connections among components.

    • Uses of OfferedI in fr.upmc.components.ports

      Subinterfaces of OfferedI in fr.upmc.components.ports 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  DataInboundPortI
      The interface DataInboundPortI represents the category of ports used by components exchanging data rather than being called for their services.
      interface  DataOutboundPortI
      The interface DataOutboundPortI represents the category of ports used by components exchanging data rather than calling providers for their services.
      interface  DataTwoWayPortI
      The interface DataTwoWayPortI represents the category of PortI that cater for exchanging data among components that act both as clients and service providers towards each others on the same interface.
      interface  InboundPortI
      The interface InboundPortI represents the category of PortI that cater for incoming calls from client components towards the service providers.
      interface  TwoWayPortI
      The interface TwoWayPortI represents the category of PortI that cater for incoming and outgoing calls among components that act both as clients and service providers towards each others on the same interface.
      Classes in fr.upmc.components.ports that implement OfferedI 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractDataInboundPort
      The class AbstractDataInboundPort partially implements an inbound port for data exchanging components.
      class  AbstractDataOutboundPort
      The class AbstractDataOutboundPort partially implements an outbound port for data exchanging components.
      class  AbstractDataTwoWayPort
      The class AbstractDataTwoWayPort partially implements a data two-way port for components exchanging data with each others in a peer-to-peer fashion.
      class  AbstractInboundPort
      The class AbstractInboundPort partially implements an inbound port which implements the offered interface of the provider component so that the provider can be called through this port.
      class  AbstractTwoWayPort
      The class AbstractTwoWayPort partially implements a two-way port for components calling each others in a peer-to-peer fashion.
